| MainHazards = NFPA-H = 3 NFPA-F = 0 NFPA-R = 0 RPhrases = , ,  SPhrases = , ,  RSPhrases = FlashPt = 250 Â°C
| Autoignition = ExploLimits = PEL = RTECS = BO3150000
  }} }} 'Benzalkonium chloride', also known as 'alkyldimethylbenzylammonium
  chloride' and 'ADBAC', is a cationic surface-acting agent belonging to the
  quaternary ammonium group. It has three main categories of use: as a biocide,
  a cationic surfactant, and phase transfer agent in the chemical industry. The
  chemical is a nitrogenous mixture of alkylbenzyldimethylammonium chlorides of
  various even-numbered U.S. Environmental Protection Agency:
  [http://www.epa.gov/oppsrrd1/reregistration/REDs/adbac_red.pdf Reregistration
  Eligibility Decision for Alkyl Dimethyl Benzyl Ammonium Chloride
  (ADBAC)] alkyl chain lengths.
